attributes.action: admit that his signing of the Lisbon Treaty was an unlawful act under the laws of the United Kingdom.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The self appointed Prime Minister Gordon Brown has no mandate from the people of the United Kingdom, in respect of the Lisbon Treaty, and is  acting and has acted, unlawfully under Common Law, dating back to The Magna Carta in appending his signature to that document on behalf of the nation. Further that he, the said Gordon Brown has, inter alia, further acted unlawfully, by breaching his Oath of Allegiance to the Sovereign, in that he has thereby surrendered control of this nation to a foreign power. His position and that of his government is therefore untenable and unacceptable, and should be replaced forthwith by way of a mandatory general election.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
